name: Beach Palace

reviews.text: For families with babies is great because kids club, pools and beach. The location is great for party people because is near (by bus or taxi) the nightlife centre. The restaurants are amazing, especially the wok and bocelli
reviews.title: Good for family trips

reviews.text: The best service ever!! Nice place to stay, very close to La Isla Mall and the party area with discos like Coco Bongo and The City (both amazing places!!). The food was very good and this is a real all inclusive resort, even they have room service 24hrs and a complete bar with beers, rum, tequila, vodka and whisky in the room.
reviews.title: Great service!!!

reviews.text: Just about to check out of the Beach Palace and how I wish I could be here for another week!
reviews.title: Everything you want in a vacation!

reviews.text: The service is exellent! We had two rooms and the upgraded us to the Presidential Suite with a breathtaking view of the beach. This place is kid friendly and the staff at the kid club is great. They have planned activities for the kids everyday which gave us the opportunity to go to get some alone time and enjoy the spa. Love the fact that this place is all- inclusive. No cooking! No cleaning! 24 hr room service! We will definitely be back!!!
reviews.title: Can't believe the high ratings!

reviews.text: Lots of options for food. We liked the Tequila resturant because it is buffet style...a little casual so the kids can be themselves. We are vegetarian and there was a lot of options for us. When we didnt want something from the buffet, Jose Molina, the manager would have something specially prepared for us.
reviews.title: The experience of a lifetime!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great food, great service, friendly atmosphere, top of the line liquor. My only regret is that I
reviews.title: Late March 2012 Vacation

reviews.text: returned home weighing much more than left. Will definitely be back next year.
reviews.title: Excellent overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, everything was great from check-in to checkout. Extremely friendly staff. Long pants needed for the Italian restaurant. There was a slight smell of sewage emanating from the northwest corner of the pool area. I believe it was due to the construction in the building next to the hotel. It was enough to be annoying. Any other location around the pool seemed to be free from the smell. Change dollars to pesos here in the states, else the best exchange rate typically is at the hotel. If you go out in town for anything, pay in pesos. If you pay in dollars, the locals love to short change you in pesos. I'd been shorted a few times with change received in pesos. There were kids of all ages at this resort, but it wasn't a bother at all. Make sure you book your transportation from the airport to the hotel a few days before you get there. Send email tp 'transfercancun@palaceresorts.com'. Include your arrival date and time, flight number, resort reservation number, membership number and number in your party.
reviews.title: They won't let put 3.5 stars

reviews.text: Comparing this resort to Couples Swept Away in Negril, Iberostar Grand Bavarro in Punta Cana, DR, and Excellence in Riviera Maya.
reviews.title: Dream vacation in Cancun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Resort itself: The resort is "nice", a la granite and marble tile stuff, whatever. It was (re)built in 2007 I think so it is fairly new. The set-up is much more like a hotel than the other near compounds I have stayed at previously. It is a 12-14 story high-rise with around 24 rooms per floor, 12 facing the ocean and 12 facing the lagoon. We had an ocean-view room which was great EXCEPT for the giant hideous concrete sound bar thing they built on the pool that obscures some of the ocean-view. It is clearly visible on the Palace website and they need to detonate it. Location of the place is great in my opinion, walking distance to many restaurants and La Isla mall. One large pool with two smaller pools on either side of it, one of those smaller pools having a swim-up bar. And this is NOT an adults-only resort. There were a ton of kids running around. WAY more than I expected. Resort no where near as good as Iberostar Grand Bavarro or Excellence, but nicer than Couples Swept Away.
reviews.title: Spring Break at Beach Palace

reviews.text: We (my husband and I) decided to stay at Beach Palace after finding that Cancun Palace was sold out, and actually thought we were getting a good deal due to the #2 rating on TA.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, but not worth it as an AI

reviews.text: The Pros:
reviews.title: Beach Palace 2012

reviews.text: - The rooms were fantastic. We did not spring for an ocean front room, but our room was lovely. Slight wrap-around porch allowed us to see the ocean and the other side of the peninsula, comfortable beach furniture on the porch, great setup in the room and a large jacuzzi. The rooms were some of the best we have stayed at in terms of size, cleanliness, comfort, and features.
reviews.title: The Right Staff make a Vacation Extra Special.

reviews.text: - The sports bar made very good drinks.
reviews.title: Excellent vacation @ Beach Palace!

reviews.text: - All the hotel staff were friendly, from the folks at check-in to the folks on the beach.
reviews.title: Thanks to all the great staff at the Beach Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great stay on our honeymoon. The option to visit other palace resort properties such as we did in playa del carmen is great and allows us to actually use the all-inclusive package on several places.
reviews.title: honeymoon

reviews.text: Had a terrific week at Beach Palace. So good, that we became Palace Elite members! Pick up at the airport went smoothly. Was greeted upon check-in with a welcome flower and yummy pink drink. Had the family category room. 2 adjoining whirlpool rooms. Only adult room was supposed to have liquor dispenser, but kids room had it too. Good thing we trust our kids.
reviews.title: Great week at Beach Palace

reviews.text: Teresa in Guest Services was terrific. Always friendly and helpful. Palace Planners were great too. Answered all of our questions about how to use our resort credits. We used everyon one of them! Went to Tulum Mayan ruins and Aqua World Sub Sea/snorkel tour, massages for me, hubby and son and mani/pedis for my girls. Did a photo shoot on the beach.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Rooms were beautiful and well maintained. Shower was hot but water pressure was fantastic. Biosilk products for the adults, Loreal for the kids. Had to ask for new towels or we didn't get them. If you want maid service, you have to press the button near the door. Also, Palace is a very green, environmentally friendly hotel. If you want lights or air conditioning, you have to put your room key in a little slot by the front door. Kind of confusing until you get used to it.
reviews.title: Beach Palace Exceptional

reviews.text: Food was good in the Wok and Bocelli's. Didn't try the steak house. It was outside the building and very windy. Buffet was OK. Just not a lot of variety. Go to the dinner shows. Michael Jackson and Fire show are usually accompanied by a dinner on the pool patio or beach. We didn't do them because we got down from the Sky bar too late. I wish we had tried the dinner shows for some variety in food. Gabriella at the grill at breakfast is always so happy and she whips up a mean omelette. Waffles were heavenly. Lunch is best at the grill by the pool or from the grill menu.
reviews.title: Outstanding!!!!

reviews.text: Been here for one week, from March 25 to April 1st. it is very nice hotel. rooms are compfortable and relaxing. the Spa was the best. Gabriela for Breakfast is the best chef in town, she can cook the eggs to ur desire. Always with big smile in her face. she spoke on face time with our relatives in Canada while she was preparing our breakfast.. hahaha.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: the only downside, is that the guest service, the timesharers and the Palace vaccation planners do not offer enough info regarding their membership plans,, they just want to sell you the membership.
reviews.title: Improvements needed urgently

reviews.text: other than that the hotel is very nice and enjoyable place to be at.
reviews.title: Dream Vacation!

reviews.text: We have just returned from a weeks stay and would comment as follows, we are a family of two adults and two children aged 12 & 14 and reside in the UK. This was our first trip to Mexico but we are very well travelled on a global basis. The location is great right on a fantastic beach with a perfect ocean, clear, blue and warm. The room was great, 9th floor, good size, perfect view. The hotel was at 55% occupancy for the first four days which is where it needed to stay to maintain great service, the last three days were up to 95% occupancy and the hotel was too small for the volume of people. There are three restaurants and a buffet restaurant. The wok and Italian are excellent, the steak house and buffet are poor. There is no where to have a chilled drink outdoors in the evening,big problem so I recommended they move the steak house up stairs and create a cool bar area outside though they will need to do something about the wind. The staff are generally good but some have an attitude especially in the wok restaurant. The pools loose the sun at 16.00 hrs, not good. For the past three days the hotel ran out of towels, no body went out of their way to sort this basic service,poor!. The entertainment needs review. The team work very hard day and night but the schedule lacks quality and excitement, again the wind is an issue. The hotel is well maintained, clean and tidy and service around the pool and on the beach is excellent. We would not return to this hotel given all the above good and bad factors. having to wait for a table in the evening to dine is not acceptable.
reviews.title: Pretty darn good

reviews.text: Colin and family
reviews.title: Really, really nice resort

reviews.text: Earlier this month we returned to the Beach Palace exactly one year since our last visit. We were very surprised to see that the Beach Palace continues to provide an even better experience than before with the addition of the water slide and new shopping stores. The true standout however is the low turnover they have in staff. It is amazingly comforting to see some of the staff from our previous visit whose service continues to outshine other luxury properties. It all starts with a young man named Jose Luis who greets us at the valet stand. He remembered me and my family from last year by our last name. He is very attentive and always makes sure you don't have to wait long for a taxi. By the poolside there is no one more helpful than Luz Yanet Sanchez, who is as attentive as is possible. If you are down by the breach there is a young man named Elias who really stood out for his attention to detail and making sure we didn't burn in the hot sun. Isabel Sepulvedra is another standout who makes you feel you selected the right hotel in the way she ensures her guests are being attended to. In the sports bar making sure the right games are on TV and attending to our party is Senior Victor, who always makes sure we are enjoying our vacation. There was a young man named Alfonso in the sports bar who also made sure our family felt welcomed each and everytime we visited the sports bar. In Restaurant Tequila, Carlos Abraham remembers what we drink every morning and we always like to have our table in his area. The master of the grill however is Gabriella, who mans both the omelette station and the pancake grill at the same time. She always cooks the breakfast just right. In short, for a most comforting vacation where you feel great in every location of a hotel I could not think of a better location than the Beach Palace. Looking forward to returning in 360 more days.
reviews.title: Worth coming back to again!

reviews.text: My daughter's wedding was beautiful and flawless. My daughter planned her wedding in three months and was able to have a perfect wedding because her wedding coordinator Suzette Alvar Caballero. She was well prepared and took care or every single detail to the minute. We were very nervous because we made several changes to the table settings and they worked with us and the tables were beautiful. My daughter's bouquet was beautiful and the same for the center pieces. Our coordinator was always there for us and assuring us that the table settings would be beautiful. The wedding setup and the tables were beautiful. The food was more than enough and delicious. We had Mariachi band that made the wedding extra special. The players were dressed beautiful and made it very special. We never felt rushed and the DJ stayed at least 1 hour later that what we booked. Our coordinator stayed until the party was done and took care of all the details. We enjoyed the party so much because every single detail was taken care for us.
reviews.title: Destination Wedding

reviews.text: This is the reason why I highly recommend the Beach Palace Hotel for a destination wedding.
reviews.title: Best Service and Wonderful location

reviews.text: Entire Staff is Great, Attentive, and pleasing! Rooms and view are amazing!! Food was delicious at EVERY restaurant. The waiters were quick to respond to any needs. The only downfall was not much of a nightlife nor entertainment. Any entertainment was over by 10pm. However, clubs are a walk away (on flats). Shopping center almost across the street. Bus transportation easy to take to downtown, mercado 28 or walmart and Sams.
reviews.title: Have stayed at other Palaces and this one does not match service

reviews.text: Member of the Palace Resorts for 6 years and have never had an issue at any of their resorts prior to this trip. Was with 18 additional friends and family over Thanksgiving Week and was very disappointed in the Beach Palace. Was told that we would have beach front rooms and when we got there had none available. The people who book our tours and spa messed up on times and such several times. I literally felt like I spent 1/4 of my vacation sitting at the tour place fixing their mistakes. Our wait in the Italian Restaurant was 45 minutes before we even received our appetizer. The steak house was completely out of steak and baked potatoes by 6:30pm however the waiters and chef was very apologetic and tried to accommodate us and our needs. This was due to improper ordering of food by the powers to be. Guest of ours had called down to front desk because their faucet was broken and never had anyone come to fix it as well as other guest of ours called down for pillows and such and never received them. We wanted to go scuba diving and had discussed this with tour people who were only willing to have us use aqua world so we could obtain our scuba certificate to go and since aqua world only offers them 1 day a week we were unable to go only to find out that the Moon Palace offers scuba lessons everyday but yet we were not referred to them to get our lessons. My personal opinion is due to the tour people would not make commission off of us going to the Moon Palace and receiving our lessons there. The spa there was wonderful with an employee there by the name of Elizabeth I believe who took extra great care of her guest who was helping us in and out of the sauna and steam room. The sports bar had great bartenders Erik and Zacharias that made us feel at home. Isaha/Isreal gave an incredible massage. Wilbur and Angel at the pool bar was amazing and always kept us happy. When we went to xplor there was a huge discrepancy with us coming back on a bus where they had us not on any list and since we are pretty experienced travelers we made sure that we held the company accountable to get us back to our hotel. Cancun's public transportation is incredible and have always felt safe. I agree great for families with younger children not for couples or even teenagers. we went out to Moon Palace for the day and our teenagers had way more fun out there they said and once again we received the impeccable service and food we have always know the Palace Resorts to give at the Moon Palace that day. We have stayed at the Moon, Sun, Cozumel and Cancun several times a year and have always felt like family. The Beach Palace has some stepping up to do to even come close to the resorts these other Palace resorts are.
reviews.title: Great for Families - Not for Couples

reviews.text: Had friends with us........food excellent, staff friendly and courteous. Great atmosphere. Enjoyed our week with you!!!
reviews.title: beach was one of the best

reviews.text: Our friends were totally impressed!!
reviews.title: Best Holiday Ever!!

reviews.text: Will definitely return to the Beach Palace.
reviews.title: A Piece Of Heaven Indeed!

reviews.text: Walking distance to downtown.
reviews.title: Fabulous Vacation!
Best resort we have ever been to
reviews.text: Joined the locals on the bus and never once felt unsafe.
Beach Palace is a modern, immaculate hotel about 20-25 minutes from the airport. I'll give quick highlights and lowlights.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel. Good service. All you need in an all-inclusive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service:
reviews.title: LOVE Palace Resorts!

reviews.text: Check-in was very simple, we had our room keys within minutes. Service at the restaurants and buffet was consistently good, but some servers definitely gave more attention. For example, some took a long time to refill coffee in the am.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.text: Food:
reviews.title: Employees at the Beach Palace, Cancun

reviews.text: Food was very good. A nice mix of American standards and local Mexican cuisine. The food was fresh and there were plenty of options. I will say that as a family with two small children, I found it disappointing that the buffet doesn't open for lunch until 12:30. My kids were tired by then.
reviews.title: Pretty good overall

description: If you are seeking a sensational family vacation resort look no further. A beautiful stretch of white sand, premier location in the heart of Cancun's hotel zone close to La Isla shopping and entertainment options, and the modern facilities of Beach Palace create the perfect combination for an unforgettable escape.
